meanings.definition: The language, ideas, arts, and inventions of a particular group of people.
examples: Both the Incan and Egyptian cultures built pyramids.

images.alt: Photo of sculptures on a Singapore temple.
images.description: From the corner of a building and looking upward, parts of two sides of a building are seen. The sides of the building are covered with colorful figures including human figures and dragon shapes.
images.caption: Religion and art are important aspects of human culture.

meanings.definition: To take away honor, value, quality, esteem or character from someone or something.
examples: He dishonored his oath of office when he lied to the people.

images.alt: Photo of a grave stone with spray paint.
images.description: A grave stone in a cemetary has a name, dates, and text inscribed on it. Black spray paint is over the carved surface, forming letters.
images.caption: Spraying graffiti on a grave stone dishonors the dead.

meanings.definition: To move from one place to another.
examples: The school bus transported the students from the bus stop to the middle school.

images.alt: Photo of two people riding on a motorcycle.
images.description: Two people ride on a motorcycle. The first person, sitting in the front, wears a helmet and holds onto the handlebars. The second person sits behind the first, with hands extended slightly forward. Trucks and buildings are in the background of the photo.
images.caption: Motorcycles are just one way to transport people from one place to another.

meanings.definition: to make sure or certain of something.
examples: Elle closed the door to ensure that no one else could hear the conversation.

meanings.definition: Not showing responsibility or good judgment; not able to be trusted.
examples: It is irresponsible to text while driving a car because it can lead to an accident.

meanings.definition: the language, ideas, arts, and inventions of a particular group of people, at a particular time.
examples: Both the Incan and Egyptian civilizations built pyramids.

images.alt: Photo of sculptures and a Great Pyramid in Egypt.
images.description: In the distance is a large pyramid made of stone. In the foreground is an enormous stone sculpture of a sphinx, a creature with the body of a lion and the head of a human.
images.caption: Religion and art are important aspects of human civilizations.

source.title: Great Sphinx of Giza and the pyramid of Khafre
source.author: Hamish2k

meanings.definition: To take away value, quality, esteem or character from someone or something.
examples: The politician tried to debase his rival’s good reputation by spreading lies about her.

images.alt: Photo of a grave stone with spray paint.
images.description: A grave stone in a cemetary has a name, dates, and text inscribed on it. Black spray paint is over the carved surface, forming letters.
images.caption: Spraying graffiti on a grave stone is an attempt to debase the memory of the dead.

meanings.definition: moved from one place to another.
examples: The couple hoped that the car would convey them to the party on time.

images.alt: Photo of a ship filled with large containers.
images.description: A large, long ship moves through water. On the deck of the ship are rows of large, rectangular boxes stacked in columns of four. The rows fill the boat from the front to the rear of the boat, and from side to side.
images.caption: This large ship conveys containers from one part of the world to another.

meanings.definition: To make sure or certain that something is true.
examples: William used an outdoor thermometer to confirm how hot or cold it was.

meanings.definition: Not showing responsibility or good judgment; not able to be trusted.
examples: A decision to speed through the school zone is injudicious and could mean that your driver's license will get taken away.

meanings.definition: A mixture or collection showing differences.
examples: The many different colors, shapes, sizes, and shapes of flowers around the world is a great example of the diversity of plant life on Earth.

images.alt: Photo of a group of men and women.
images.description: A group of nine people. The people in the group include women and men that have varying ages, skin tones, hair colors, and ways of dressing.
images.caption: Diversity is strong when every person can share their opinion and listen respectfully and thoughtfully to others.

source.title: FirstEnergy’s Diversity and Inclusion Programs Honored by Crain’s Cleveland Business
source.author: FirstEnergy Corp.

meanings.definition: The movement from one place to another.
examples: Some monarch butterflies make a migration each year that starts in New England and ends in Mexico, 2,500 miles away.

images.alt: Photo of a field with geese standing and flying over.
images.description: A large open field with geese standing in it. Over the field, above the standing geese, are many more geese flying from left to right in a group.
images.caption: An example of geese migration in autumn to a warmer climate.

meanings.definition: To suppose; to accept as true
examples: I presumed that school would be closed when we had the big snow storm.
Ani opened her hand to reveal that she was holding a marble.

images.alt: Photo of magnifying glass showing closeup of section of picture.
images.description: In the center is a photo if a flower. A hand holds a magnifying glass over a section of the picture. The magnifying glass results in a large closeup of a section of the flower, showing details of that section.
images.caption: A closer look can reveal small details.

meanings.definition: To make better or add to.
examples: To enhance the look and taste of the plain cupcake, the children added frosting, candy, and sprinkles on top of it.

images.alt: Photo of measuring spoon holding salt.
images.description: A small measuring spoon is in the center of the photo. Small white crystals fill the measuring spoon. Below the spoon is a metal bowl that contains a dough-like substance covered with other white crystals.
images.caption: Adding spice enhances the flavor of foods.
